Name: Suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the birthdays of Lord Krishna and Lord Buddha.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the birthdays of Lord Krishna and Lord Buddha.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section one. Subdivision a of Section 19-163 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended as follows:
§19-163 Holiday suspension of the parking rules. a. All alternate side of the street parking rules shall be suspended on the following holidays: Christmas, Yom Kippur, Rosh Hashanah, Ash Wednesday, Holy Thursday, Good Friday, Ascension Thursday, Feast of the Assumption, Feast of All Saints, Feast of the Immaculate Conception, first two days of Succoth, Shimini Atzareth, Simchas Torah, Shevuoth, Purim, Orthodox Holy Thursday, Orthodox Good Friday, first two and last two days of Passover, the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha, Asian Lunar New Year, the birthday of Lord Krishna, the birthday of Lord Buddha and all state and national holidays.
§2. This local law shall take affect immediately upon its enactment into law.

PH
5.05.05
LS # 2771
